Example.Title: Visual Basic Line Plots, Visual Basic Computing Module
Example.Description:
This example demonstrates how an interactive plot with multiple lines is created and configured in Visual Basic (.NET50, Windows). The data are computed in a separate computing class for more convenient syntax. Following concepts are shown:
  • use DataScreenRect to size & position the data output area for the plot cube and get rid of unneeded margins around the plot
  • configure logarithmic axis scales
  • configure axis labels
  • configure manual ticks
  • add a legend to the plot
  • create and call a computing function/module in Visual Basic while utilizing all ILNumerics performance rules, with input and output arguments.
    •
